item.title: Interesting concept.. run with it. *removed*
item.dc:creator: @ExtremeX-Scape Ryley
item.description:
@ExtremeX-Scape wrote:

matzie:

What i thought a good use for it would be for chat Dialogs. Each Dialog has a question with so many responses. To get next one, find your current one, and the child will be the value of which one you selected. If null, chat completes. If 1 child. i Diversified it on purpose. So there are applications to it, but i agree the speed is an issue

that is so much overkill for something so simple

item.title: Interesting concept.. run with it. *removed*
item.dc:creator: @ExtremeX-Scape Ryley
item.description:
@ExtremeX-Scape wrote:

[quote=“imthenull, post:5, topic:535198”][quote author=matzie link=topic=654001.msg4381019#msg4381019 date=1383563229]
It is running with the same idea as a List, but expanding to the n-th dimension.
[/quote]When will you ever exceed the 255th dimension when using arrays? Let me show you exactly what a array with 255 dimensions looks like…

Object[][][][][][][][][][][][][][][][][][][][][][][][][][][][][][][][][][][][][][][][][][][][][][][][][][][][][][][][][][][][][][][][][][][][][][][][][][][][][][][][][][][][][][][][][][][][][][][][][][][][][][][][][][][][][][][][][][][][][][][][][][][][][][][][][][][][][][][][][][][][][][][][][][][][][][][][][][][][][][][][][][][][][][][][][][][][][][][][][][][][][][][][][][][][][][][][][][][][][][][][][][][][][][][][][][][][][][][][][][][][][][][][][][][][][][][][][][][][][][][][][][][][][][][][][][][][][][][]

Your solution is really inefficient and slow in comparison to plain jane arrays. I certainly wouldn’t use this in place of arrays or the collections library.[/quote]

When would you ever need to use more than 10 dimensions really, if your array gets that large perhaps some optimization should be done.

Read full topic

item.title: Interesting concept.. run with it. *removed*
item.dc:creator: @matzie matzie
item.description:
@matzie wrote:

MultiDimensionalArray<ElementType,ArrayType> I realised i could use the same variable for each, but never got that far lol. The intent was to make an infinitely expandable array.(Abstractly)
It is running with the same idea as a List, but expanding to the n-th dimension.

Here is an example of it in use.

[code]public class Foo {
public static class Tree extends MultiDimensionalArrayElement<String,Tree> {
public Tree(String id) {
super();
setValue(id+"");
setSubArray();
}
}
public static void main(String[] args) {

    MultiDimensionalArray d;
    d = new MultiDimensionalArray(new Tree("-1"));
    for (int i = 0 ; i < 10 ; i++) {
        d.add(new Tree(i+""));
        for (int j= 0; j< 10; j++) {
            d.getElement(i).add(new Tree(i+" "+j));
            for (int k = 0; k<20 ; k++) {
                d.getElement(i,j).add(new Tree(i+" "+j+" "+k));
            }
        }
    }
    for (int i = 0 ; i < 10 ; i++) {
        System.out.println(d.getValue(i));
        for (int j= 0; j< 10; j++) {
            System.out.println(d.getValue(i,j));
            for (int k = 0; k<20 ; k++) {
                System.out.println(d.getValue(i,j,k));
            }
        }
    }
}

}
[/code]

Read full topic
